BFE18E4FDADA49BA9A1D39F8AE14F1AB.description: develop and/or select pieces of work and other materials that provide evidence of their skills and achievements in areas related to the green industries, for inclusion in a portfolio (e.g., work logs, skills checklist, résumé, references, safety certificates).

31453D5B84D14026B1EA05C38B3C1F27.description: demonstrate an understanding of the work habits that are important for success in the green industries, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., working safely, teamwork, reliability, organization, working independently, initiative, self-advocacy, customer service);

61B412ECA99C4EDBB55D2CD776958AEF.description: demonstrate an understanding of the Essential Skills that are important for success in the green industries, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., reading text, writing, document use, computer use, oral communication, numeracy, thinking skills);

63B79345E0A246DF8FFBE362D8AC2866.description: identify groups and programs that are available to support students who are interested in pursuing non-traditional career choices in the green industries (e.g., mentoring programs, virtual networking/support groups, specialized postsecondary programs, relevant trade/industry associations);

5CD6B097C71846FAB1CA0D1FC5BB7B72.description: identify ways of acquiring knowledge and experience in green industry occupations (e.g., through part-time work experience, cooperative education, guest speakers, field trips, job shadowing);

8D58C81924E44922BBF5D274BC15665C.description: describe career opportunities in a variety of sectors in the green industries (e.g., landscape architect, arborist, forester, florist, horticulturalist, farmer, herder) and the education, training, and certification required for employment in green industry occupations (e.g., training in first aid, CPR, and WHMIS; driver’s licence; cut skid certification);

5B473799277A42DC9BA5C445446F5A79.description: Career Opportunities: identify careers in the green industries and describe the skills, education, and training required for entry into these positions.

D25FEABE9EE74F63B16679CEEB061730.description: identify and comply with legislation, regulations, and guidelines pertaining to the health and safety of workers in the green industries (e.g., Occupational Health and Safety Act [OHSA], Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System [WHMIS])

C658679C0A8F4A8A93C52F9FBE8F6781.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply safe shop and site practices (e.g., using correct lockout procedures, using equipment guards, holding shop orientation sessions, having sanitary wash stations available, cleaning up spills and leaks when they happen, keeping areas clean and clear of obstruction, storing materials and equipment neatly and safely);

286C0FCF2C434E38A3B68CE4CE11D6AC.description: identify potential hazards (e.g., trip hazards, environmental conditions, danger zones) related to the materials, site conditions, and equipment used in the work environment;

055D932D8F884429BDCA13C717D381F6.description: demonstrate an understanding of appropriate uses, safe operating practices, and correct maintenance procedures for materials, tools, and equipment that are commonly used in the green industries (e.g., lawn maintenance equipment, garden tools, chainsaws, skidding equipment, mechanical harvesting equipment, milking machines, feeding systems);

05B351E6C3EB47F892B7CE5DACED98D5.description: identify the personal protective clothing and equipment needed to perform various green industry tasks safely, and use as required to ensure their own and others’ safety in the work environment;

E9A7B8EB579D43F38148DB260CFF4C7D.description: Health and Safety: demonstrate an understanding of and comply with occupational health and safety standards;

49AB73B1A4994F09B3A3C84D47A2F5E3.description: describe the effects of local green industries on the community (e.g., effects on employment, water and air quality, leisure opportunities, aesthetics; availability of locally produced specialty products).

E7CB71A92C79489CB68B88169DCE0402.description: describe the relationships between a variety of local green industries and their local outlets (e.g., garden centre and nursery, vegetable production and farmers’ market, maple syrup production and specialty food store, flower producer and florist);

DD86105FDF864AF3B601FBFB4482E311.description: identify local green industries (e.g., largescale farms, greenhouse operations, florists, community gardens, golf courses) and describe their activities or products within a specific region

95A8BA84E68F4B568B950A94FA524973.description: Local Industries: describe the relationship of a variety of green industries to the local communities in which they operate.

3E7A244C3C454A19B6CBD9E6EA988B5E.description: identify ethical issues related to the green industries (e.g., animal welfare, breeding of animals for fur, animal cloning, migrant labour, monopoly control of food production as a possible consequence of the use of genetically modified crops).

29EEF9452E264CBD8B6B5D44438BD584.description: describe the societal and economic implications of recent innovations and trends in the green industries (e.g., mechanization and its effects on productivity and employment, expanded distribution systems and their consequences for consumer choice and local production, transgenic plants and their effects on food cost and availability);

EDE73668621349E3B974B1751132F701.description: Technology and Society: describe the societal implications of current practices and trends in the green industries

EB8A9E2AE161475C94562E999E178BD1.description: identify best management practices, environmentally sustainable practices, and technologies that can be used to reduce the harmful effects of green industry operations (e.g., composting, recycling, use of renewable energy sources, land retirement, minimal use of fertilizers and pesticides).

327FEBFD3B9446299BC51DC733EA5FBE.description: identify ways in which green industry activities affect the environment (e.g., contamination of water by fertilizers, pesticides, and manure; emission of greenhouse gases from animals, tilled soils, and equipment; emission of air pollutants from gasoline- and diesel-powered machinery; noise pollution; high energy demand);

4A47A0657D6C4751B7581351F5AC1A7A.description: Technology and the Environment: identify the impact of green industries on the environment and describe ways of minimizing harmful effects;

CAF43637E3524B9693E0A04C4468687C.description: interpret simple working drawings (e.g., garden sketches, plans for a forest, field plot designs, greenhouse drawings).

2A1DBC9CD73B452582C0A9DBA41F1E22.description: demonstrate competence in the application of fundamental construction skills (e.g., selecting materials, measuring, cutting, joining) to a variety of construction projects (e.g., hard construction, laying pavers and flagstones, constructing a garden, building storage bins, creating a display booth);

06B846F7E75C463CBA6FB7046D2513C8.description: complete a variety of green industry projects and tasks using appropriate tools, equipment, and materials (e.g., make a hand-tied bridal bouquet, prune a tree, scale a log, transplant a shrub, create a walkway, design a butterfly garden);

C9706A29EC5B46E891F027D11C288F12.description: Technical Skills: demonstrate competence in applying introductory technical skills used in the green industries.

A3A4883154E64660909D4099483928CC.description: apply techniques relating to the maintenance, care, and handling of plants and/or animals, using environmental best practices (e.g., mulching gardens, feeding and watering, product processing, visual inspection).

18A75C8535024D2782A23B582DD48E4A.description: demonstrate competence in the application of a production process used in the green industries (e.g., foundation planting, pasteurization, inspection, electronic sorting, transplanting);

26D21F9077664080BDC01DF3766321E5.description: demonstrate competence in applying techniques related to the propagation and growth of plants and/or the breeding and growth of animals (e.g., seeding, hatching eggs, making cuttings);

3F2E504244CB452DAB874FD9CC0679FD.description: demonstrate the ability to use fundamental skills required in green industry design and planning processes (e.g., prepare a site inventory, create a base plan for a layout, complete a twodimensional survey, create a floral design, use plan symbols, interpret a plan);

1FA6C4D4443747CC8ED7EBB9A2DB5442.description: Design and Production: apply effective design and production practices as they relate to a variety of green industries;

106A9C9224ED47DA9A1BF6F70AFFC01C.description: use imperial and metric units of measurement correctly and make accurate calculations and measurements for various applications in the green industries (e.g., land area, volume, distance, scaling, pacing, weight, unit conversions, tree height).

6FAB211870C24323BC4E8A8E7EDBB0AD.description: identify sources of information about techniques and best practices in the green industries (e.g., government reports and fact sheets; news articles; manufacturers’ catalogues, manuals, and fact sheets; industry newsletters; industry events; Internet information);

285C0C393E1C4FB3A666DF93330E948E.description: demonstrate an understanding of terminology used in the green industries and use it correctly in oral and written communication (e.g., hardwood, propagation, line flower, vine, topsoil);

CF83B09A39D54E6CB9B6A325895F6262.description: Technological and Mathematical Literacy and Communication Skills: demonstrate competence in the use of mathematical, documentation, and communication skills as they apply to the green industries.

E8DD35B6565C43439F7FC94832AE6470.description: identify and describe a variety of structural or mechanical systems used within the green industries (e.g., systems for heating, cooling, storage, irrigation, fertilizing, feeding, harvesting, cleaning, milling).

B508D204CA014642ACDC322D7BCB3C15.description: demonstrate an understanding of a variety of processes used in plant and/or animal care (e.g., plant growth experiments, propagation, pruning, sheep shearing);

86EA3D184DFD4F92AD797CABC3040DA4.description: identify a variety of design concepts and production processes and systems used in the green industries (e.g., simple garden designs, floral designs, greenhouse production layouts, barn layouts, lumber grading systems, sow operations, grape production);

D8B8B64C538849FEA11F1553D2DDEA06.description: describe the steps in applying a design or problem-solving process to green industry tasks

04150A40449E406CA31F5CDF76686BBD.description: Designs, Processes, and Systems: demonstrate an understanding of design procedures and applications and production processes and systems as they relate to the green industries;

BC5E866A11754A759C7C2A9FAAB6D743.description: identify a variety of pests and diseases (e.g., Asian long-horned beetle, thrips, grubs, moles, Dutch elm disease, mastitis, hoof-and-mouth disease) and describe their effects on plants and/or animals.

02FD6A7C780B425AB30790B33ADF54F1.description: describe biological factors that affect growth and post-harvest quality (e.g., plant type, photosynthesis, genetics);

1D4A9EF001CC4334B8DD4959CC0BB74D.description: describe environmental factors that affect growth and post-harvest quality (e.g., light, temperature, soils, nutrients, water, wind);

3A81406A203F4A408E8616339DCE4B83.description: Factors Affecting Growth: describe the factors affecting the growth and care of plants and/or animals;

1E2187558B0247BC9CD75AAD945ED824.description: describe important physiological processes in plants and/or animals (e.g., germination, photosynthesis, reproduction, digestion).

ACB4A6156F424B5EBC2FE2072CBE321B.description: identify the basic components of common plants and/or animals and describe their functions (e.g., leaves, flowers, bark, internal organs);

4841048A01CC4E96A62185419D32ACB6.description: describe the key distinguishing characteristics of different plant and/or animal groups (e.g., shrubs, trees, annuals, flowers, animal breeds);

8DC447B251D14F4C9D1010D94226BDC7.description: Basic Biology: demonstrate an understanding of plant and/or animal biology and species classification as they relate to the green industries;
